Suggestions for Sanitarium Diet 

     The patients are to be provided with an abundance of wholesome, palatable food, prepared and served in so appetizing a way that they will have no temptation to desire flesh-meat. The meals may be made the means of an education in health reform. Care is to be shown in regard to the combinations of foods given to 
                                                                           284
the patients. Knowledge in regard to proper food combinations is of great worth, and is to be received as wisdom from God. . . .
